message_1:
Suppose Alice and Bob are trying to decide which movie to watch on a Friday night. Alice prefers romantic comedies while Bob prefers action movies. If they each choose a movie to recommend without knowing what the other has chosen, they will each get a payoff of 2 if they end up watching the same movie and a payoff of 1 if they don't. However, if they both recommend different movies, Alice will get a payoff of 0 if they watch Bob's movie and Bob will get a payoff of 0 if they watch Alice's movie. 

Assuming that Alice and Bob each want to maximize their own payoffs, what is the Nash equilibrium of this game and what are the payoffs for each player in that equilibrium?

The Nash equilibrium occurs when both players choose the strategy that is the best response to the other player's strategy.
